name: material
description: The material of the visual element.

children.name: script
children.description: Name of material from an installed script file. This will override the color element if the script exists.

children.name: uri
children.description: URI of the material script file

children.name: name
children.description: Name of the script within the script file

children.name: type
children.description: vertex, pixel, normal_map_object_space, normal_map_tangent_space

children.name: normal_map
children.description: filename of the normal map

children.name: render_order
children.description: Set render order for coplanar polygons. The higher value will be rendered on top of the other coplanar polygons

children.name: lighting
children.description: If false, dynamic lighting will be disabled

children.name: ambient
children.description: The ambient color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue, each in the range of [0,1].

children.name: diffuse
children.description: The diffuse color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue/alpha, each in the range of [0,1].

children.name: specular
children.description: The specular color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue/alpha, each in the range of [0,1].

children.name: shininess
children.description: The specular exponent of a material

children.name: emissive
children.description: The emissive color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue, each in the range of [0,1].

children.name: double_sided
children.description: If true, the mesh that this material is applied to will be rendered as double sided

children.name: pbr
children.description: Physically Based Rendering (PBR) material. There are two PBR workflows: metal and specular. While both workflows and their parameters can be specified at the same time, typically only one of them will be used (depending on the underlying renderer capability). It is also recommended to use the same workflow for all materials in the world.

children.name: metal
children.description: PBR using the Metallic/Roughness workflow.

children.name: albedo_map
children.description: Filename of the diffuse/albedo map.

children.name: roughness_map
children.description: Filename of the roughness map.

children.name: roughness
children.description: Material roughness in the range of [0,1], where 0 represents a smooth surface and 1 represents a rough surface. This is the inverse of a specular map in a PBR specular workflow.

children.name: metalness_map
children.description: Filename of the metalness map.

children.name: metalness
children.description: Material metalness in the range of [0,1], where 0 represents non-metal and 1 represents raw metal

children.name: environment_map
children.description: Filename of the environment / reflection map, typically in the form of a cubemap

children.name: ambient_occlusion_map
children.description: Filename of the ambient occlusion map. The map defines the amount of ambient lighting on the surface.

children.name: normal_map
children.description: Filename of the normal map. The normals can be in the object space or tangent space as specified in the 'type' attribute

children.name: type
children.description: The space that the normals are in. Values are: 'object' or 'tangent'

children.name: emissive_map
children.description: Filename of the emissive map.

children.name: light_map
children.description: Filename of the light map. The light map is a prebaked light texture that is applied over the albedo map

children.name: uv_set
children.description: Index of the texture coordinate set to use.

children.name: specular
children.description: PBR using the Specular/Glossiness workflow.

children.name: albedo_map
children.description: Filename of the diffuse/albedo map.

children.name: specular_map
children.description: Filename of the specular map.

children.name: glossiness_map
children.description: Filename of the glossiness map.

children.name: glossiness
children.description: Material glossiness in the range of [0-1], where 0 represents a rough surface and 1 represents a smooth surface. This is the inverse of a roughness map in a PBR metal workflow.

children.name: environment_map
children.description: Filename of the environment / reflection map, typically in the form of a cubemap

children.name: ambient_occlusion_map
children.description: Filename of the ambient occlusion map. The map defines the amount of ambient lighting on the surface.

children.name: normal_map
children.description: Filename of the normal map. The normals can be in the object space or tangent space as specified in the 'type' attribute

children.name: type
children.description: The space that the normals are in. Values are: 'object' or 'tangent'

children.name: emissive_map
children.description: Filename of the emissive map.

children.name: light_map
children.description: Filename of the light map. The light map is a prebaked light texture that is applied over the albedo map

children.name: uv_set
children.description: Index of the texture coordinate set to use.
